trans-unit.source: Configure Traffic Manager round robin traffic routing method | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure Traffic Manager round robin traffic routing method | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article will help you configure round robin load balancing for your Traffic Manager endpoints.
trans-unit.target: This article will help you configure round robin load balancing for your Traffic Manager endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Configure Round Robin routing method
trans-unit.target: Configure Round Robin routing method

trans-unit.source: A common traffic routing method pattern is to provide a set of identical endpoints, which include cloud services and websites, and send traffic to each in a round-robin fashion.
trans-unit.target: A common traffic routing method pattern is to provide a set of identical endpoints, which include cloud services and websites, and send traffic to each in a round-robin fashion.

trans-unit.source: The steps below outline how to configure Traffic Manager in order to perform this type of traffic routing method.
trans-unit.target: The steps below outline how to configure Traffic Manager in order to perform this type of traffic routing method.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the different traffic routing methods, see [About Traffic Manager traffic routing methods](traffic-manager-load-balancing-methods.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the different traffic routing methods, see [About Traffic Manager traffic routing methods](traffic-manager-load-balancing-methods.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure Websites already provides round-robin load balancing functionality for websites within a datacenter (also known as a region).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure Websites already provides round-robin load balancing functionality for websites within a datacenter (also known as a region).

trans-unit.source: Traffic Manager allows you to specify round-robin traffic routing method for websites in different datacenters.
trans-unit.target: Traffic Manager allows you to specify round-robin traffic routing method for websites in different datacenters.

trans-unit.source: Routing traffic equally (round robin) across a set of endpoints:
trans-unit.target: Routing traffic equally (round robin) across a set of endpoints:

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, in the left pane, click the **Traffic Manager** icon to open the Traffic Manager pane.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, in the left pane, click the **Traffic Manager** icon to open the Traffic Manager pane.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created your Traffic Manager profile, see [Manage Traffic Manager Profiles](traffic-manager-manage-profiles.md) for steps to create a basic Traffic Manager profile.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created your Traffic Manager profile, see [Manage Traffic Manager Profiles](traffic-manager-manage-profiles.md) for steps to create a basic Traffic Manager profile.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, on the Traffic Manager pane, locate the Traffic Manager profile that contains the settings that you want to modify, and then click the arrow to the right of the profile name.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, on the Traffic Manager pane, locate the Traffic Manager profile that contains the settings that you want to modify, and then click the arrow to the right of the profile name.

trans-unit.source: This will open the settings page for the profile.
trans-unit.target: This will open the settings page for the profile.

trans-unit.source: On the page for your profile, click **Endpoints** at the top of the page and verify that the service endpoints that you want to include in your configuration are present.
trans-unit.target: On the page for your profile, click **Endpoints** at the top of the page and verify that the service endpoints that you want to include in your configuration are present.

trans-unit.source: For steps to add or remove endpoints, see [Manage Endpoints in Traffic Manager](traffic-manager-endpoints.md).
trans-unit.target: For steps to add or remove endpoints, see [Manage Endpoints in Traffic Manager](traffic-manager-endpoints.md).

trans-unit.source: On your profile page, click **Configure** at the top to open the configuration page.
trans-unit.target: On your profile page, click **Configure** at the top to open the configuration page.

trans-unit.source: For **traffic routing method Settings**, verify that the traffic routing method is **Round Robin**.
trans-unit.target: For **traffic routing method Settings**, verify that the traffic routing method is **Round Robin**.

trans-unit.source: If it is not, click **Round Robin** in the dropdown list.
trans-unit.target: If it is not, click **Round Robin** in the dropdown list.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the **Monitoring Settings** are configured appropriately.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the **Monitoring Settings** are configured appropriately.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring ensures that endpoints that are offline are not sent traffic.
trans-unit.target: Monitoring ensures that endpoints that are offline are not sent traffic.

trans-unit.source: In order to monitor endpoints, you must specify a path and filename.
trans-unit.target: In order to monitor endpoints, you must specify a path and filename.

trans-unit.source: Note that a forward slash “/“ is a valid entry for the relative path and implies that the file is in the root directory (default).
trans-unit.target: Note that a forward slash “/“ is a valid entry for the relative path and implies that the file is in the root directory (default).

trans-unit.source: For more information about monitoring, see [About Traffic Manager Monitoring](traffic-manager-monitoring.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about monitoring, see [About Traffic Manager Monitoring](traffic-manager-monitoring.md).

trans-unit.source: After you complete your configuration changes, click **Save** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: After you complete your configuration changes, click **Save** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Test the changes in your configuration.
trans-unit.target: Test the changes in your configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Testing Traffic Manager Settings](traffic-manager-testing-settings.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Testing Traffic Manager Settings](traffic-manager-testing-settings.md).

trans-unit.source: Once your Traffic Manager profile is setup and working, edit the DNS record on your authoritative DNS server to point your company domain name to the Traffic Manager domain name.
trans-unit.target: Once your Traffic Manager profile is setup and working, edit the DNS record on your authoritative DNS server to point your company domain name to the Traffic Manager domain name.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to do this, see [Point a Company Internet Domain to a Traffic Manager Domain](traffic-manager-point-internet-domain.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to do this, see [Point a Company Internet Domain to a Traffic Manager Domain](traffic-manager-point-internet-domain.md).
